{{Infobox tree | name = Pi de les Tres Branques | image = Pont Pi de les 3 Branques.jpg | alt = Photo of Pi de les Tres Branques in 2012 | image_caption = Pi de les Tres Branques in 2012 | species = Scots pine | binomial = ''[[Pinus sylvestris]]'' | location = Pla de Campllong, [[Castellar del Riu]], [[Berguedà]], [[Catalonia]], [[Spain]] | coordinates = {{coord|42.110531|1.781891|type:landmark_region:ES-CT-BD}} | felled = | website = [http://parcsnaturals.gencat.cat/web/.content/home/coneix-nos/arbres_monumentals/arbres_monumentals_fitxes/bergueda/pi_de_les_tres_branques_i/AM140500_Pi_Tres_BranquesI.pdf official record] }} '''Pi de les Tres Branques''' ({{IPA-ca|ˈpi ðə ləs ˈtɾɛz ˈβɾaŋkəs}}, "the three-branched pine") is a dead [[pine]] tree located in the countryside near the town of [[Berga]] in north-central [[Catalonia]], [[Spain]]. It has long been regarded by some [[Catalan nationalism|Catalan nationalists]] as representing the unity of the three "[[Catalan Countries]]" and is the site of regular political-cultural gatherings. The tree has been dead since 1915 and is in poor structural condition, due in part to politically-motivated [[vandalism]], but there is a very similar living tree a short distance away known as ''Pi Jove de les Tres Branques'' ("the young three-branched pine"), which is regarded as its successor. Both are protected as "monumental trees" by the Catalan government. ==Situation== The tree is a [[Scots pine]] (''Pinus sylvestris''), {{convert|25|metre}} tall, and as its name suggests, consists of three main branches or trunks rising from a common base.{{cite web|url=http://parcsnaturals.gencat.cat/web/.content/home/coneix-nos/arbres_monumentals/arbres_monumentals_fitxes/bergueda/pi_de_les_tres_branques_i/AM140500_Pi_Tres_BranquesI.pdf|title=Arbre Monumental: Pi de les Tres Branques I|publisher=[[Generalitat of Catalonia]]|language=Catalan|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6c0gdNhTJ|archivedate=2015-10-03}} It is located in the centre of the Campllong plain, which measures about {{convert|2|km}} by {{convert|500|m}} and occupies the flat floor of a valley, surrounded by forested mountains of the [[Pre-Pyrenees]], at an altitude of {{convert|1294|metre}}. To the south, separating the valley from Berga town, is the {{Interlanguage link multi|Serra de Queralt|ca|3=Serra de Queralt (Berguedà)}} ridge, home to the {{Interlanguage link multi|Queralt Sanctuary|ca|3=Santuari de Queralt}} religious complex, and to the north are the [[Rasos de Peguera]] mountains and [[ski resort]]. Berga is {{convert|9|km}} away by road. The tree previously dominated the valley's farmed and grazed land, due to its height and full foliage, and was visible from a long distance, as is shown in old photographs. However, much of the surrounding land has now been taken over by forest, and Pi de les Tres Branques now has many other trees in its vicinity, which, together with its current skeletal form, make it much less visible than before. The valley is traversed by a minor road which terminates at the small settlement of [[Castellar del Riu]] at its western end.{{cite web|url=http://www.icc.cat/vissir3/index.html?Y=4618295.5&X=396905.5&zoom=0&layers=Topogr%26agrave%3Bfic,vector,Marker&layers_opacity=1,1,1&lang=eng|title=Local map|publisher=Cartographic and Geographic Institute of Catalonia|accessdate=2016-06-24}} The road passes close by Pi de les Tres Branques, which is indicated by a signpost. {{clear}} ==History== [[File:Pi de les Tres Branques 1905.jpg|thumb|right|alt=refer to caption|Pi de les Tres Branques in about 1905]] ===Origin=== Although legend places the tree much earlier, it has been estimated that Pi de les Tres Branques took root between 1630 and 1632, when the local farmhouse was built.{{rp|169}}{{cite news|title=El Pi|author=[[:ca:Jaume Farguell i Sitges|Jaume Farguell i Sitges]]|publisher=[[:ca:Regió7|Regió7]]|language=Catalan|date=15 June 2002}} ===Cultural recognition=== The tree had been traditionally celebrated as a symbol of the [[Holy Trinity]], and it is still a venue for religious ceremonies. The first reference in extant records was in 1685, when a cartographer wrote that it was known as the Tree of the Trinity.{{cite book|title=Verdaguer i el Pi de les Tres Branques|author=[[:ca:Ramon Felipó i Oriol|Ramon Felipó i Oriol]]|publisher=Llibres de l'Índex|date=December 2014|language=Catalan|isbn=9788494288920}}{{rp|12}}{{cite journal|url=http://www.raco.cat/index.php/Erol/issue/view/21105/showToc|title=Mapes en temps de conflicte, molt més que una ratlla sobre un paper|trans-title=Maps in time of conflict, much more than a line on paper|journal=L'Erol: Revista Cultural del Berguedà|author=Rosa Serra Rotés|date=2014|issue=121|language=Catalan|format=PDF|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6eAXw7fVI|archivedate=2015-12-30}} It is also recorded that in 1746, the bishop of [[Solsona, Lleida|Solsona]] granted [[indulgence]]s to those who prayed at the site. In 1876, the landowner of the site, in a letter to a local magazine denying that he was planning to sell the tree for timber, pointed out that it also represented the revolutionary ideals of [[Liberté, égalité, fraternité|liberty, equality and fraternity]].{{rp|1–2}} The [[Renaixença|Catalan language cultural revival of the 19th century]] saw a great increase in Catalan literature and culture.{{cite web|url=http://www.lletra.net/en/period/la-renaixenca|title=La Renaixença (The Catalan Cultural Renaissance)|publisher=Lletra: Catalan literature online|accessdate=2016-06-25}} In 1875, playwright {{Interlanguage link multi|Francesc Pelagi Briz|ca}} published a play ''[[:File:Lo Pi de las Tres Brancas (1875).pdf|Lo Pi de las Tres Brancas]]'',Spellings varied until the early-20th-century language reforms of [[Pompeu Fabra]]. which is set in Berga and at the tree,{{cite web|url=http://parcsnaturals.gencat.cat/ca/detalls/Noticia/Lo-pi-de-les-tres-branques-una-obra-de-teatre-de-lany-1875|title="Lo pi de les tres branques", una obra de teatre de l’any 1875|trans-title="Lo pi de les tres branques", a theatrical work from 1875|publisher=[[Generalitat of Catalonia]]|date=5 June 2014|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6bzXKgX0T|archivedate=2015-10-03|language=Catalan}} and contains a passage suggesting that the tree was already a Catalan national symbol.From the play (translated):
Guenyo: ... Look, see at the foot of the slope, on the plain, that gigantic pine with the half-bare stump.
Tivat: Pi de les Tres Branques.
Guenyo: You know its name?
Tivat: Every good Catalan knows it; it's the household tree. However, it was the 1888 poem "Lo Pi de les Tres Branques" by the poet Fr [[Jacint Verdaguer]], published in his anthology ''[[:File:Pátria (1888).djvu|Pàtria]]'', which brought the tree to widespread attention, converting what was mainly a local religious symbol into a significant secular national symbol. In his poem, Jacint Verdaguer created the so-called 'legend' of the king-child King [[James I of Aragon]] who after being released from captivity in [[Narbonne]] ([[France]]) travelled with his retinue through Catalonia back to his seat at [[Monzón]] in [[Aragon]], supposedly spending one of the nights sleeping under Pi de les Tres Branques, and it was there that he had an inspirational dream that he was destined to rule three kingdoms, represented by the three trunks of the tree, conquering the [[Balearic Islands]] and the [[Kingdom of Valencia]] from the [[Moors]],{{cite web|url=http://parcsnaturals.gencat.cat/ca/detalls/Article/LArbre-de-Mambre-i-el-Pi-de-les-Tres-Branques|title=L’Arbre de Mambré i el Pi de les Tres Branques|trans-title=The Tree of Mamre and Pi de les tres Branques|author=Ricard Estrada i Arimon|publisher=[[Generalitat of Catalonia]] (Natural parks dept.)|language=Catalan|date=13 July 2015|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6chT8oSWa|archivedate=2015-10-21}}{{cite book|title=Les Millors Llegendes Populars|trans-title=The Best Popular Legends|page=118|author=[[Joan Amades]]|publisher=La Butxaca|date=5 November 2009|language=Catalan|isbn=9788499300252}} which in fact [[James I of Aragon#Reconquest|he later achieved]].
{{collapse top|"Lo Pi de les Tres Branques"
(Jacint Verdaguer, 1888){{cite web|url=http://www.endrets.cat/text/112/lo-pi-de-les-tres-branques-verdaguer-jacint-locutat-per-lluis-soler.html|title=Lo Pi de les Tres Branques|publisher=Endrets: Geografia Literària dels Països Catalans|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6eMtZerkv|archivedate=2016-01-07}}|bg=#eeeeee|width=auto}} {| | colspan=3 | [[File:Lectura Verdaguer, Aplec Pi 3 Branques 2014.jpg|thumb|left|The poem being recited at the 2014 annual gathering]] |- | ''Preguem que sia aqueix Pi'' ''l'arbre sagrat de la pàtria.'' Per on baixa el Llobregat dels Pirineus a la plana, don Guillem de Mont-rodon a trenc de dia davalla, voltat de comtes i ducs en ufanosa colcada. De l'alta sella en l'arçó, sobre arabesca gualdrapa, seu en Jaume nostre rei; no du més corona encara que la de son cabell d'or que algun àngel li ha deixada. Lo tenia presoner Narbona dins sa muralla: al vencedor de Muret Mont-rodon lo demanava; Montfort no l'hi vol donar, per gendre diu que se'l guarda. Si serà son gendre o no Mont-rodon ho diu al Papa; la resposta que li fa al vell Montfort no li agrada: —Que torne el Rei a Aragó i als Pirineus la seva àliga.— Catalunya, aixeca el front, doble sol avui t'aguaita, lo sol que et surt a Orient i el que t'ix a tramuntana. Lo que et surt al Pirineu te vol donar una ullada, mes ell, infant de sis anys, no vol ésser vist encara, ja el veuran a Lleida prou davant la cort catalana. Abans d'arribar a Berga s'enfilen per la muntanya, per entre Estela i Queralt de Campllong envers la plana; quan són al mig de Campllong la nit fosca és arribada. Lo Campllong té com un breç dues serres per barana, per coberta un bosc de pins verds tot l'any com l'esmaragda. Corona immensa de tots és una hermosa Pinassa, pinetells semblen los pins entorn de llur sobirana, geganta dels Pirineus que per sang té rius de saba. Com una torre és son tronc que s'esbadia en tres branques com tres titans rabassuts que sobre els núvols s'abracen, per sostenir en lo cel una cúpula de rama que fa ombra a tot lo pla com una nova muntanya. Don Jaume cau de genolls i en son èxtasis exclama: —Al Pare, Fill i Esperit per tots los segles hosanna! tres persones i un sol Déu que aquí sa firma ha posada, com en l'arbre de Mambré on Abraham reposava.— Fent la senyal de la creu se recolza a la Pinassa, i la son del paradís a ses parpelles davalla. Don Guillem de Mont-rodon, que és son àngel de la guarda, l'abriga amb son gran escut on vermellegen les Barres. Alça els ulls a l'Infinit que obira en sa tenda blava clavetejada d'estels i al cim lluna minvanta. En dolça contemplació lo sorprèn lo bes de l'alba; al bes de l'alba i al seu don Jaume se desvetllava: —He somniat que era gran i d'un bell país monarca, d'un bell país com aqueix entre el mar i la muntanya. Com eix Pi meravellós, mon regne posà tres branques, foren tres regnes en un, ma corona els coronava.— Esbrinant somni tan dolç lo sol li dóna a la cara i esporuguida a ponent la mitja lluna s'amaga. Lo somni del rei infant lo vell templari l'acaba en extàtica oració, espill de visió més clara. Veu Catalunya la gran fer-se més gran i més ampla, robant als moros València, prenent-los l'Illa Daurada. Unides veu a les tres com les tres cordes d'una arpa, les tres nimfes d'eixa mar, d'aqueix jardí les tres Gràcies. Mes al veure desvetllar lo lligador d'eixa garba, profeta, al Conqueridor sols li diu eixa paraula: —Preguem, que sols Déu és gran, los homes són ombra vana; preguem que sia aqueix Pi l'arbre sagrat de la pàtria.— |   | ''We pray that this Pine will be'' ''the sacred tree of the fatherland.'' Where the [[Llobregat]] descends from the [[Pyrenees]] to the plain, Sir [[:ca:Guillem de Mont-rodon|William of Mont-rodon]] goes down at break of day, surrounded by counts and dukes in a pompous cavalcade. On the pillion of the high saddle, over an arabesque blanket, sits James our king; he wears no more crown than that of his golden hair that some angel has loaned him. He was held prisoner inside the walls of [[Narbonne]]: to the [[battle of Muret|victor of Muret]] Mont-rodon asks for him back; [[Simon de Montfort, 5th Earl of Leicester|Montfort]] will not give him back, saying he is growing up into a son-in-law. Will he be a son-in-law or not Mont-rodon asks the Pope; the reply he gives him does not please old Montfort: —The King should return to [[Aragon]] and his eagle to the Pyrenees.— Catalonia, raise your brow, a double sun watches over you today, the sun which rises for you in the east and the one that appears in the north. The one that comes from the Pyrenees wants to have a look at you, but he, infant of six years, does not want to be seen yet, as they will see him full well at [[Lleida]] before the Catalan court. Before arriving at Berga they climb through the mountains, between [[:ca:Cogulló d'Estela|Estela]] and [[:ca:Serra de Queralt (Berguedà)|Queralt]] towards the plain of Campllong; on reaching the middle of Campllong the dark night has arrived. Campllong has like a cradle two ridges as a railing, for cover a forest of pines green all year like an emerald. The biggest crown of all is a beautiful Great Pine, other trees look like mushrooms around their overlord, giantess of the Pyrenees who has rivers of sap for blood. Its trunk is like a tower that splits into three branches like three stout [[Titan (mythology)|titans]] embracing above the clouds, to support in the sky a dome of branches casting a shadow over the whole plain like a new mountain. King James falls to his knees and in his ecstasy exclaims: —To the Father, Son and Spirit through all the ages [[hosanna]]! three persons and only one God who has put his signature here, like on the tree of [[Mamre]] where Abraham rested.— Making the sign of the cross he rests against the Great Pine, and the sleep of paradise descends on his eyelids. Sir William of Mont-rodon, who is his guardian angel, covers him with his big shield where the [[Coat of arms of Catalonia|Bars]] blaze red. He raises his eyes to the Infinite which he discerns in its blue canopy studded with stars and at the summit a waning moon. In sweet contemplation the kiss of dawn surprises him; at dawn's kiss and his kiss King James awakens: —I dreamed that I was great and monarch of a beautiful country, of a beautiful country like this between the sea and the mountain. Like this wonderful Pine, my kingdom had three branches, they were three kingdoms in one, my crown crowned them.— Finding this dream so sweet the sun shines on his face and frightened at the west the half-moon hides. The dream of the infant king is finished by the old [[Knights Templar|Templar]] in an ecstatic speech, mirror of a clearer vision. He sees the great Catalonia make itself greater and bigger, stealing [[Valencia]] from the [[Moors]], taking from them the [[Mallorca|Golden Island]]. He sees all three united like the three strings of a harp, the [[Thriae|three nymphs]] of that sea, the [[Charites|three Graces]] of that garden. But seeing awake the binder of that sheaf, a prophet, the Conqueror says to him only these words: —We pray, since only God is great, men are a feeble shadow; we pray that this Pine will be the sacred tree of the fatherland.— |} {{collapse bottom}}
The previous year, Verdaguer had stayed a few days in the nearby Queralt Sanctuary and visited the tree.{{cite journal|url=http://raco.cat/index.php/Erol/issue/view/13322/showToc|title=Les estades de Mossèn Cinto Verdaguer al Berguedà|trans-title=Fr Cinto Verdaguer's stays in Berguedà|journal=L'Erol: Revista Cultural del Berguedà|author=Josep Noguera i Canal|date=1994|issue=44|language=Catalan|format=PDF|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6epY8Nidx|archivedate=2016-01-26}} "Lo Pi de les Tres Branques" recounts the story of James and the tree's symbolism of the Trinity and the unity of the Catalan Countries, and expressed the wish that it be adopted as Catalonia's national tree. The poem has remained the tree's principal literary connection, regularly recited at gatherings there.{{cite web|url=http://www.elpuntavui.cat/noticia/article/2-societat/5-societat/556904-vora-un-simbol-dunitat-dels-paisos-catalans.html|title=Vora un símbol d'unitat dels Països Catalans|trans-title=Beside a symbol of unity of the Catalan Countries|publisher=[[El Punt]]|language=Catalan|date=15 July 2012|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSIVBJm9|archivedate=2013-03-28}} It starts and ends with the often-quoted lines "Preguem que sia aqueix Pi / l'arbre sagrat de la pàtria." ("We pray that this Pine will be / the sacred tree of the fatherland."). It is accepted that in fact Verdaguer invented the story of James's sojourn for his poem, since there is no record of it before then, and that the poem's popularity created the legend.{{rp|3}}{{cite journal|url=http://www.tasta.cat/wp-content/uploads/2012/11/tasta03.pdf|title=El Pi de les Tres Branques, un símbol viu|trans-title=Pi de les Tres Branques, a symbol lives|journal=Tasta: El Berguedà|author=Quirze Grifell|date=Summer 2008|issue=3|language=Catalan|format=PDF|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6LCWMMXPf|archivedate=2013-11-17}}{{rp|28}} In 1901, when Verdaguer was presiding at the [[Floral Games]], a traditional Catalan poetry contest, he coined the sobriquet "Guernica of Catalonia" for the tree, referring to the [[Gernikako Arbola|Tree of Guernica]], an oak tree which symbolises Basque freedom.{{cite web|url=http://www.324.cat/noticia/24462/altres/Berga-recorda-Verdaguer-i-el-Pi-de-les-Tres-Branques-amb-una-exposicio-a-lOficina-de-Turisme|title=Berga recorda Verdaguer i el Pi de les Tres Branques amb una exposició a l'Oficina de Turisme|trans-title=Berga remembers Verdaguer and Pi de les Tres Branques with an exhibition at the Tourism Office|publisher=[[TV3 (Catalonia)]]|date=9 November 2006|language=Catalan|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSJEq2Lr|archivedate=2013-03-28}} He also suggested the tree's trunks symbolised the three major awards of the contest: country, faith, and love.{{cite journal|url=http://raco.cat/index.php/Erol/issue/view/13416/showToc|title=El Pi de les Tres Branques i Mn. Cinto Verdaguer|journal=L'Erol: Revista Cultural del Berguedà|author=[[:ca:Ramon Felipó i Oriol|Ramon Felipó i Oriol]]|date=2002|issue=72|language=Catalan|format=PDF|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSLu7nhF|archivedate=2013-03-28}}{{rp|4}} In May 1901 the landowner transferred ownership of the tree to the {{Interlanguage link multi|Catalanist Union|ca|3=Unió Catalanista}} (''Unió Catalanista''), a grouping of various nationalist organisations, at their meeting in [[Terrassa]], though the transaction was never legally registered.{{rp|4}} This new popularity coincided with the slow decay of the tree, which eventually died in 1915. In 1987 the [[Generalitat|Catalan regional government]] listed the tree as a protected "monumental tree", one of the first three such trees (along with Pi Jove and ''Roure de Can Codorniu'' in [[Sant Sadurní d'Anoia]]).{{cite web|url=http://dogc.gencat.cat/ca/pdogc_canals_interns/pdogc_resultats_fitxa/?action=fitxa&documentId=34301|title=Diari Oficial de la Generalitat de Catalunya: ORDRE de 20 d'octubre de 1987, sobre declaració d'arbres monumentals|trans-title=Order of 20 October 1987, concerning declaration of monumental trees|date=20 October 1987|publisher=Generalitat of Catalonia|language=Catalan|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6fGtIwjnX|archivedate=2016-02-13}} A silhouette of Pi de les Tres Branques (while it was alive) is now used by the government as a generic logo for monumental trees.{{cite web|url=http://parcsnaturals.gencat.cat/web/.content/home/coneix-nos/arbres_monumentals/per_saber_ne_mes/altres_fonts_dinformacio/catam_inf_2_3_20130131a.pdf|title=Arbres monumentals: Information sources|publisher=[[Generalitat of Catalonia]]|format=PDF|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6eMyKeT4b|archivedate=2016-01-07}} {{clear}} ===Damage and death=== Before its death, Pi de les Tres Branques had been attacked several times, for economic and/or political reasons. [[File:Pi de les Tres Branques (abans 1915).jpg|thumb|alt=refer to caption|Pi de les Tres Branques, already dead, with the 1907 wall in place]] In 1901, Jacint Verdaguer reported that a woodcutter had recently tried to cut down one of the trunks, causing it to lean out; damage from which the tree was unlikely to recover.{{rp|2}} It was also reported that around 1895, cuts had been made to [[resin extraction|tap the tree for resin]], and a fire lit at its base to speed the process. This and other damage prompted the Catalanist Union to erect a high stone wall around the tree in 1907 to protect against further attacks, though it was suggested that the building work also contributed to the subsequent death of the tree.{{rp|5}} By 1915 the aforementioned wall had been demolished.{{cite journal|url=http://www.raco.cat/index.php/Erol/article/view/169597/250119|title=Jaume Huch i Guixer, fotògraf (1)|trans-title=Jaume Huch i Guixer, photographer|journal=L'Erol: Revista Cultural del Berguedà|author=Domènic Huch, Jaume Huch|date=1983|issue=6|language=Catalan|format=PDF|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6coms280e|archivedate=2015-11-05}}{{rp|1}}as shown in the photograph in the cited source, also seen at [[:File:Pi de les Tres Branques 1915.jpg]] In 1910, it was reported that the tree had lost its leaves, though others suggest a date of 1913, and it was completely dead by 1915.{{rp|5}}{{cite web|url=http://www.festes.org/arxius/pitresbranques.pdf|title=Quan va morir El Pi de les Tres Branques?|trans-title=When did Pi de les Tres Branques die?|author=[[:ca:Ramon Felipó i Oriol|Ramon Felipó i Oriol]]|publisher=Rebombori Digital|date=June 2008|language=Catalan|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSJzXTRk|archivedate=2013-03-28}} Scots pines have a natural lifespan of up to over 700 years, depending on the region.{{cite web|url=http://www.conifers.org/pi/Pinus_sylvestris.php|title=Pinus sylvestris (Scots pine) description|author=Christopher J. Earle|publisher=The Gymnosperm Database|date=27 May 2011|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSK5kCyZ|archivedate=2013-03-28}} Many years later,An anonymous internet forum comment says in the 1940s [http://www.racocatala.cat/forums/fil/45784/estat-del-pi-les-tres-branques] the trunk that was damaged as reported by Verdaguer, was struck by [[lightning]] and the top half broke off.{{rp|6}} The remnant of that trunk is still supported by a small stone wall. {{clear}} ===Later damage=== [[File:Restauració Pi 3 Branques - 1.jpg|thumb|left|alt=refer to caption|Preparing to restore the severed trunk, July 2015]] Following its death, the tree has continued to be attacked many times by elements opposed to its political symbolism. In 1939, after the end of the Civil War, supporters of the victorious [[Nationalist faction (Spanish Civil War)|Nationalist faction]] started an attempt to topple the tree, but were repelled by local people. It has also been subject to regular minor damage such as [[anti-Catalanism|anti-Catalan]] graffiti. However, the most serious deliberate damage happened during the night of 12/13 May 2014, when the tallest trunk was sawn off at its base with a [[chainsaw]], by unknown perpetrators.{{cite web|url=http://www.vilaweb.cat/noticia/4190898/20140513/symbolic-tree-representing-catalan-countries-vandalized.html|title=Symbolic tree, representing Catalan Countries, vandalized|publisher=[[VilaWeb]]|date=13 May 2014|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6PeG1kYfk|archivedate=2014-05-17}}{{cite web|url=http://ccaa.elpais.com/ccaa/2014/05/13/catalunya/1399979176_682805.html|title=Los Mossos buscan a los autores del ataque contra el Pi de les Tres Branques|trans-title=The Police seek the perpetrators of the attack against Pi de les Tres Branques|author=Maiol Roger|publisher=[[El País]]|language=Spanish|date=13 May 2014|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6PeGDlghI|archivedate=2014-05-17}} Following the vandalism, the severed trunk was stored, and it was eventually decided to re-attach it with artificial supports, several steel straps connecting the trunk to the base; this work was carried out in early July 2015 at a cost of €35,000, shared by the Catalan government and the [[Province of Barcelona|Barcelona provincial]] administration.{{cite web|url=http://www.regio7.cat/bergueda/2015/07/08/pi-vell-tres-branques-recupera/321104.html|title=El Pi de les Tres Branques torna a fer honor al seu nom|trans-title=Pi de les Tres Branques honours its name again|publisher=[[:ca:Regió7|Regió7]]|language=Catalan|date=9 July 2015|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6aEagG4F4|archivedate=2015-07-23}} In January 2016, the tree was again attacked (along with Pi Jove) with a 10 cm chainsaw cut into one of the other trunks. This damage was quickly patched up with steel straps as before.{{cite web|url=http://www.regio7.cat/bergueda/2016/02/09/subjecten-ferules-metalliques-brac-serrat/348242.html|title=Fotogaleria: Subjecten amb fèrules el braç serrat del Pi de les Tres Branques|trans-title=Photo gallery: Steel straps are applied to the cut branch of Pi de les Tres Branques|publisher=[[:ca:Regió7|Regió7]]|language=Catalan|date=9 February 2016|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6fRq7k8aq|archivedate=2016-02-20}} {{clear}} {{anchor|pijove}} ==Pi Jove== {{Infobox tree | name = Pi Jove de les Tres Branques | image = Acte al Pi Jove de les Tres Branques, febrer 2015.jpg | alt = Photo of the tree in February 2015 | image_caption = Ceremony at Pi Jove, February 2015 | species = Scots pine | binomial = ''[[Pinus sylvestris]]'' | location = Pla de Campllong, [[Castellar del Riu]], [[Berguedà]], [[Catalonia]], [[Spain]] | coordinates = {{coord|42.109286|1.779139|type:landmark_region:ES-CT-BD}} | seeded = | felled = | website = [http://parcsnaturals.gencat.cat/web/.content/home/coneix-nos/arbres_monumentals/arbres_monumentals_fitxes/bergueda/pi_de_les_tres_branques_ii/am1405002f.pdf official record] }} Following the death of Pi de les Tres Branques, another three-branched pine {{convert|300|metre}} away had been adopted as its successor. ''Pi Jove de les Tres Branques'', or ''Pi de les Tres Branques II'', is also hundreds of years old, but smaller at {{convert|19|m}} tall. Its similarities to the main tree had been noticed as far back as 1810, when the [[Baron of Maldà]] mentioned it in his diary.{{cite web|url=http://elmati.cat/article/4657/el-pi-jove-de-les-tres-branques|title=El Pi Jove de les Tres Branques|author=[[:ca:Ramon Felipó i Oriol|Ramon Felipó i Oriol]]|publisher=El Matí Digital|language=Catalan|date=19 June 2015|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6dR9delnv|archivedate=2015-11-30}} At the 1921 rally at the site, following a campaign by poet-politician [[Ventura Gassol]], Pi Jove was inaugurated as the successor to the then-dead main tree. Speaking at the event, Gassol invited the landowner, who was present, to donate the tree to the [[Commonwealth of Catalonia]] (a semi-recognised autonomous government), but he declined, saying that practical effort is more important than symbols.{{rp|7}} It has since become the main attraction for younger and more radical elements of the nationalist movement.{{cite web|url=http://www.festes.org/articles.php?id=673|title=Aplec del Pi de les Tres Branques|author=Bernat Ferrer i Frigola|publisher=Rebombori Digital|date=22 May 2007|language=Catalan|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSJd1RS0|archivedate=2013-03-28}}{{cite web|url=http://www.naciodigital.cat/naciobergueda/noticia/2536/intenten/serrar/branques/pi/jove|title=Intenten serrar unes de les branques del Pi Jove|trans-title=Attempt made to saw off one of the branches of Pi Jove|author=Aida Morales|publisher=[[:ca:Nació Digital|Nació Digital]]|language=Catalan|date=11 June 2015|accessdate=2015-10-03}} The older and younger trees are often simply called "el Pi Vell" (the old pine) and "el Pi Jove" (the young pine) respectively, to distinguish the two. Along with Pi Vell, Pi Jove was registered as a protected "monumental tree" in 1987.{{cite web|url=http://parcsnaturals.gencat.cat/web/.content/home/coneix-nos/arbres_monumentals/arbres_monumentals_fitxes/bergueda/pi_de_les_tres_branques_ii/am1405002f.pdf|title=Arbre Monumental: Pi de les Tres Branques II (Pi Jove)|publisher=[[Generalitat of Catalonia]]|language=Catalan|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6c0giVLRS|archivedate=2015-10-03}} ===Damage=== Unlike Pi Vell, Pi Jove had escaped the attentions of vandals until more recently, due to its lower political profile and greater distance (200 m) from the road. In 2010, it was discovered with a circumferential cut through the [[Bark (botany)|bark]], in addition to apparent [[shotgun]] damage. Vandals attacked it in June 2015, attempting to saw through one of its trunks, though it was not thought that the damage was serious enough to kill the affected trunk. As a precaution, in December 2015 [[arborist]]s installed a frame to hold the three trunks together and ensure their stability.{{cite web|url=http://www.naciodigital.cat/naciobergueda/noticia/4207/experts/asseguren/pi/jove/es/mant/amb/vida/despr/atac|title=Els experts asseguren que el Pi Jove es manté amb vida després de l'atac|trans-title=Experts satisfied that Pi Jove remains alive following the attack|author=Aida Morales|publisher=[[:ca:Nació Digital|Nació Digital]]|language=Catalan|date=16 December 2015}} In January 2016, deeper chainsaw cuts were discovered on the already-damaged trunk which are believed harsh enough to kill the trunk altogether; these vandals also attacked Pi Vell. ==The annual gathering== Pi de les Tres Branques, as a symbol of the united Catalan Countries, or simply of Catalan self-determination, has been the site of large political rallies since the turn of the 20th century, at first sporadically, but annually since 1980. The first record of a political assembly there was in October 1900, when a largebetween 50 and 400, depending on the sources group of [[Carlist]] troops, led by {{Interlanguage link multi|Josep Grandia|ca|3=Josep Grandia i Soler}}, based themselves there in preparation for their part in the failed {{Interlanguage link multi|October 1900 Carlist uprising|es|3=Sublevación carlista de octubre de 1900|lt=Carlist uprising}}.{{rp|119–122}}{{cite journal|url=http://hemerotecadigital.bne.es/issue.vm?id=0001284393|title=El Carlismo en Armas|trans-title=Carlism at Arms|journal=[[:es:Nuevo Mundo (revista)|Nuevo Mundo]]|pages=14–15|date=7 November 1900|language=Spanish|format=PDF|archiveurl=https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Nuevo_mundo_%28Madrid%29._7-11-1900.pdf|archivedate=2016-01-25}} [[File:Segell 1904 Unió Catalanista.jpg|thumb|left|alt=refer to caption|1904 [[Cinderella stamp#Political and propaganda stamps|promotional stamp]] issued by the Catalanist Union featuring Pi de les Tres Branques and the date 25 September]] The first major rally was in 1904 when the Catalanist Union organised an assembly there to celebrate its acquisition of the site, on Sunday 25 September. The ceremony, and associated events in Berga the day before, attracted several hundred activists, with messages from foreign sympathisers being read out.{{cite journal|url=https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Joventut_no._242,_1904-09-29.pdf|title=La Festa del Pi de las Tres Brancas|journal=Joventut: Periòdich catalanista|author=Arnau Martínez y Seriñá|date=29 September 1904|issue=242|language=Catalan|format=PDF}}{{rp|8}} Another rally was held in 1915.{{cite journal|url=http://raco.cat/index.php/Erol/issue/view/13416/showToc|title=Les set ombres de les tres branques|trans-title=The seven shadows of the three branches|journal=L'Erol: Revista Cultural del Berguedà|author=Jan Grau|date=2002|issue=72|language=Catalan|format=PDF|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSLz3RxT|archivedate=2013-03-28}}{{rp|3}} The next major rally was held in 1921, on 25 July, the [[James, son of Zebedee|St. James]] holiday;{{rp|7}} a key point of that event included the inauguration of Pi Jove as the intended replacement for the original tree. Subsequent political developments made it difficult to hold large organised rallies at the site. Catalan political gatherings were banned during the 1923–1930 dictatorship of [[Miguel Primo de Rivera]], travel was difficult during the 1936–1939 [[Spanish Civil War]], and political gatherings were again banned in [[Francoist Spain]] (1939–1975) and for some time after. It was not until 1980, following the [[Spanish transition to democracy|restoration of democracy in Spain]], that the first annual gathering of the modern era took place, starting a tradition of a large gathering at the site on the third Sunday of July each year.{{cite web|url=http://www.enciclopedia.cat/enciclop%C3%A8dies/gran-enciclop%C3%A8dia-catalana/EC-GEC-0050841.xml?s.q=pi+de+les+tres+branques|title=el Pi de les Tres Branques|publisher=[[Enciclopèdia Catalana]]|language=Catalan|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSIisH6H|archivedate=2013-03-28}} Attendance at the gathering has varied; the 1980 inaugural gathering attracted 3,000 visitors, reached a peak of 14,000 in 1986,{{cite web|url=http://rcpartitrepublicacatala.wordpress.com/2011/07/31/el-pi-de-les-tres-branques-cal-recuperar-la-diada/|title=El Pi de les Tres Branques. Cal recuperar la Diada|trans-title=Pi de les Tres Branques. The day must be reclaimed.|author=Agustí Soler i Regàs|publisher=Catalan Republican Party ([[Catalan Solidarity for Independence]])|language=Catalan|date=31 July 2011|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSKQGWwV|archivedate=2013-03-28}} but has since declined, with attendances of 2,000 in 2001,{{cite web|url=http://elpais.com/diario/2001/07/16/catalunya/995245647_850215.html|title=Los independentistas piden en el Pi de les Tres Branques la autodeterminación y Pere Esteve no excluye un referéndum|trans-title=The independentists ask for self-determination at Pi de les Tres Branques and Pere Esteve does not rule out a referendum|author=Enric Badia|publisher=[[El País]]|language=Spanish|date=16 July 2001|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6e8kNVrlF|archivedate=2015-12-29}} 1,000 in 2012{{cite web|url=http://www.castellardelriu.com/aplec-del-pi-de-les-tres-branques/|title=Aplec del Pi de les Tres Branques 2012|publisher=Municipality of Castellar del Riu|language=Catalan|date=15 July 2012|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSKcv3pE|archivedate=2013-03-28}} and 1,500 in 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.324.cat/noticia/2452898/catalunya/Aplec-simbolic-sota-el-Pi-de-les-Tres-Branques-mutilat-el-passat-mes-de-maig|title= Aplec simbòlic sota el Pi de les Tres Branques mutilat el passat mes de maig|trans-title=Symbolic gathering under Pi de les Tres Branques mutilated last May|publisher=[[TV3 (Catalonia)]]|language=Catalan|date=20 July 2014|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6RHTh9m5Y|archivedate=2014-07-23}} [[File:Gegants al Pi 3 Branques, 2014.jpg|thumb|alt=refer to caption|''Gegants'' at the 2014 gathering]] It attracts Catalan nationalists of many different viewpoints, including those attending a [[mass (Catholic Church)|mass]], political activists from the entire nationalist spectrum left and right giving speeches, organisations hosting stands and selling political books and souvenirs, and performers of traditional Catalan cultural activities such as ''[[sardana]]'' bands and dancers, ''[[castell]]ers'' (human towers), and ''[[gegants]]'' (giant puppets). The gathering also marks the culmination of the four-day ''El Rebrot'' ("The [[Shoot]]") [[music festival|musical]]/political festival which has been held in Berga almost every yearIt was held at [[Argentona]] in 2007 [http://www.directe.cat/noticia/2199/avui-comenca-el-rebrto-festival-de-joves-dels-paisos-catalans-2199] since 2001, organised by the [[Maulets (politics)|Maulets]]/[[Arran (organization)|Arran]] left-wing youth organisation.{{cite web|url=http://www.bergactual.com/2011/07/16/el-rebrot-compleix-el-seu-dese-aniversari-revitalitzant-el-pi-de-les-tres-branques|title=El Rebrot compleix el seu desè aniversari revitalitzant el Pi de les Tres Branques|trans-title=El Rebrot celebrates its tenth anniversary revitalising Pi de les Tres Branques|author=Pere Gendrau|publisher=Berguedà Actual|language=Catalan|date=16 July 2011|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6e8iplgx2|archivedate=2015-12-29}} Because of the shortage of parking at the site, [[shuttle bus]]es are provided by Berga town council, who also organise catering for the crowds in the town after the event.{{cite web|url=http://www.ajberga.cat/ajberga/agenda/detall.php?apartat=&activitat=909|title=Aplec Pi de les Tres Branques 2015|publisher=Berga town council|language=Catalan|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6carOfl4M|archivedate=2015-10-27}} ===Controversies=== Events at the gathering have several times resulted in controversies, and clashes between rival political factions. Following the 1981 event, the Catalan parliament president [[Heribert Barrera]], two parliamentary deputies, and several others, faced criminal charges of "insulting the feelings and unity of the Spanish nation and distributing illegal publications".{{cite web|url=http://elpais.com/diario/1982/02/11/espana/382230013_850215.html|title=Barrera quiere declarar ante un tribunal que aun no existe|publisher=[[El País]]|trans-title=Barrera wants to answer charges at a court which does not yet exist|date=11 February 1982|language=Spanish|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6emf0vH9h|archivedate=2016-01-24}} The charges were dropped after three years.{{cite journal|url=http://raco.cat/index.php/Erol/issue/view/20986/showToc|title=Preguem que sia aquest pi l'arbre sagrat de la Pàtria|trans-title=We pray that this pine will be the sacred tree of the fatherland|author=[[:ca:Ramon Felipó i Oriol|Ramon Felipó i Oriol]]|journal=L'Erol: Revista Cultural del Berguedà|date=2014|issue=120|language=Catalan|format=PDF|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6epUdBWGe|archivedate=2016-01-26}} The 1986 gathering was marred by the [[flag desecration|burning]] of Spanish flags and harassment of moderate groups. As a result, the mainstream political parties [[Democratic Convergence of Catalonia|Democratic Convergence]] and [[Republican Left of Catalonia|Republican Left]] stayed away from the 1987 event.{{cite journal|url=http://raco.cat/index.php/Erol/issue/view/13416/showToc|title=De 1980 fins al 2001: La Diada Nacionalista del Pi de les tres Branques, segons els diaris|trans-title=The Nationalist Day at Pi de les Tres Branques, according to the newspapers|journal=L'Erol: Revista Cultural del Berguedà|author=[[:ca:Ramon Felipó i Oriol|Ramon Felipó i Oriol]]|date=2002|issue=72|language=Catalan|format=PDF|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSM6SVcS|archivedate=2013-03-28}}{{rp|1–2}} In 1988, different factions of the far-left [[Movement for Defence of the Land]] (MDT) fought each other.{{cite book|title=Memòries d'un Rebel: Records d'un exmilitant de Terra Lliure|trans-title=Memories of a rebel: Memoirs of a former [[Terra Lliure]] activist|author=[[:ca:Frederic Bentanachs|Frederic Bentanachs]]|publisher=Llibres de l'Índex|date=2003|language=Catalan|isbn=9788495317582}}{{rp|134–135}}{{rp|33–34}} In 1991, MDT militants attacked youth members of Democratic Convergence and Republican Left, and in 1996, hooded left-wing militants came from their assembly at Pi Jove to attack members of [[Estat Català]] at Pi Vell.{{rp|3}}{{cite web|url=http://hemeroteca-paginas.lavanguardia.com/LVE01/PUB/1996/07/22/LVG19960722-011.pdf|title=Un grupo de encapuchados provoca una batalla campal en la Diada del Pi de les Tres Branques|trans-title=A group of hooded people start a field battle at the Pi de les Tres Branques gathering|author=Felip González|publisher=[[La Vanguardia]]|date=22 July 1996|format=PDF|language=Spanish|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSKojNKg|archivedate=2013-03-28}} Since the events of 1996, the authorities have increased security at the gathering, and the event has returned to a peaceful cultural atmosphere.{{rp|3}} ==Management and development plans== Although both Pi Vell and Pi Jove are officially protected, they are easily accessible in an isolated wooded area, and therefore vulnerable to vandalism as well as natural hazards such as lightning and wildfire. Several proposals have been made over the years to improve the site. Around 1990, a private business identified the Campllong valley, with Pi de les Tres Branques as a central attraction, as one of the possible locations for a large-scale Catalan-identity [[theme park]] called "Identirama". A different site was eventually selected, but the project was abandoned.{{cite web|url=http://hemeroteca-paginas.lavanguardia.com/LVE01/PUB/1999/10/20/TAR19991020-001.pdf|title=El Port Aventura que no fue|trans-title=The Port Aventura that never was|author=Enric Alfonso|publisher=[[La Vanguardia]]|language=Spanish|format=PDF|date=20 October 1999|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6emsRTHxN|archivedate=2016-01-25}} In 2003, the [[Catalan parliament]] passed a resolution urging development of a government plan to improve the site. A government report in 2001, re-published in 2004, included a proposal to cut down the fragile Pi Vell, leaving the stump in place along with a commemorative monument, and purchase and develop the site as a public amenity.{{rp|19–20}}{{cite web|url=http://regio7.mynewsonline.com/?method=content&ref=RE7201003060002|title=El Berguedà exigeix protecció al Pi de les Tres Branques, que és monumental des del 1987|trans-title=Berguedà urges protection for Pi de les Branques, which is a monument since 1987|author=Pilar Marquez|publisher=[[:ca:Regió7|Regió7]]|language=Catalan|date=6 March 2010}} The attack on Pi Jove in 2010 prompted activists to complain about perceived ongoing lack of action by the authorities, and prompted the local municipality of [[Castellar del Riu]] to start work with interested parties to develop a plan to secure the site. In 2012 the mayor announced plans to take over the maintenance of the land around the two trees and develop facilities for visitors, including a car park and information panels.{{cite web|url=http://www.naciodigital.cat/noticia/44697/ara/parc/tematic/tres/branques|title=I ara... el parc temàtic del Pi de les Tres Branques!|trans-title=And now... the Pi de les Tres Branques theme park!|publisher=[[:ca:Nació Digital|Nació Digital]]|language=Catalan|date=13 July 2012|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSMcKQCB|archivedate=2013-03-28}} In March 2015, following the serious attack on Pi Vell ten months before, the government set up a working group consisting of representatives of the Barcelona provincial administration, the local municipality, and the [[Institute of Catalan Studies]], to manage the maintenance and protection of the two trees.{{cite web|url=http://dogc.gencat.cat/ca/pdogc_canals_interns/pdogc_resultats_fitxa/?action=fitxa&documentId=710168|title=Diari Oficial de la Generalitat de Catalunya: Resolució ARP/2770/2015|publisher=Generalitat of Catalonia|language=Catalan|date=30 November 2015|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6fGqe36sI|archivedate=2016-02-13}} The first result was the repair of the damaged tree in July, and in February 2016 they decided to place [[Closed-circuit television|video security cameras]] at the site, watching both trees.{{cite web|url=http://www.ccma.cat/324/el-pi-de-les-tres-branques-estara-vigilat-amb-cameres/noticia/2714095/|title=El Pi de les Tres Branques estarà vigilat amb càmeres|trans-title=Pi de les Tres Branques will be watched with cameras|publisher=[[TV3 (Catalonia)]]|language=Catalan|date=18 February 2016|accessdate=2016-02-20}} {{anchor|others}} ==Other associated three-branched pines== Another similarly named tree is ''Pi de les Tres Branques de Freixinet'', located near the village of Freixinet in the municipality of [[Riner]] in central Catalonia.Coordinates: {{coord|41.931758|1.573682|name=Pi de les Tres Branques de Freixinet}} This tree is also protected by the Catalan government, since 1988, but was killed in a [[forest fire]] in 1998.{{cite web|url=http://www20.gencat.cat/docs/parcsnaturals/Home/Coneix-nos/Arbres_monumentals/Arbres_monumentals_declarats/Solsones/Pi%20de%20les%20Tres%20Branques%20de%20Freixenet/am3518601_pi_tres_branques_freixinet_m.pdf|title=Pi de les Tres Branques de Freixinet|publisher=[[Generalitat of Catalonia]]|language=Catalan|date=22 September 2011|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6FSL698Oq|archivedate=2013-03-28}} In recent times, local bodies such as the municipality of Castellar del Riu or Berga or the local branch of the [[Catalan National Assembly]], have adopted the practice of presenting a young three-branched pine tree or sapling claimed to be a descendant of Pi de les Tres Branques to other bodies, as symbols of solidarity. Early examples include presentations to the [[Castle of Gallifa]] in 1986, and the Castle of St. Ferran in Berga in 1992 (along with a sapling of the Tree of Guernica).{{rp|17}} The practice gained momentum following the February 2014 presentation of a young tree to the town of [[Folgueroles]], to commemorate Jacint Verdaguer who was born there; that tree has since been vandalised.{{cite web|url=http://www.naciodigital.cat/osona/noticia/43084/mutilen/pi/tres/branques/folgueroles|title=Mutilen el Pi de les Tres Branques de Folgueroles|trans-title=Pi de les Tres Branques of Folgueroles is mutilated|publisher=Nació Digital|language=Catalan|date=16 September 2014|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6XifwDHim|archivedate=2015-04-11}} Subsequent 2014 recipients have included [[Andorra la Vella]], [[Sant Hipòlit de Voltregà]], and [[Saldes]].{{cite web|url=http://www.ara.cat/societat/Mutilen-pi-tres-branques-Folgueroles_0_1213678744.html|title=Mutilen el pi de les tres branques de Folgueroles|trans-title=Pi de les Tres Branques of Folgueroles is mutilated|publisher=[[Ara (newspaper)|Ara]]|language=catalan|date=17 September 2014|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6XigdkVZA|archivedate=2015-04-11}} The Forest Museum in [[Sant Celoni]] also claims to have five descendants of Pi de les Tres Branques in its grounds.{{cite web|url=http://www.lavanguardia.com/politica/20140515/54406947871/nietos-pi-de-les-tres-branques-sant-celoni.html|title=Cinco nietos del Pi de les Tres Branques crecen vigorosos en Sant Celoni|trans-title=Five grandchildren of Pi de les Tres Branques grow vigorously in Sant Celoni|author=Sílvia Hinojosa|publisher=[[La Vanguardia]]|language=Spanish|date=15 May 2014|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6eJgq2uJo|archivedate=2016-01-05}} Pi de les Tres Branques de Folgueroles, maig 2014.jpg | Ceremony at Pi de les Tres Branques of [[Folgueroles]] (at left), May 2014 Pi 3 Branques, vila de Berga.jpg | In Plaça dels Països Catalans, Berga town ==See also== * [[List of notable trees]] * [[Catalan symbols]] ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==Notes== {{reflist|30em|group=note}} ==External links== {{commons category}} * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xHkLB18Ob0M Video of the 2013 annual gathering at Pi de les Tres Branques] {{Catalonia topics}} {{Good article}} [[Category:Individual conifers]] [[Category:Catalan nationalism]] [[Category:Catalan symbols]] [[Category:Berguedà]] [[Category:Jacint Verdaguer]] [[Category:1910s individual tree deaths]] [[Category:Individual trees in Spain]]

{{hatlink|For the real place in Italy, see [[Prehistoric Park (Italy)]].}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} {{Use British English|date=August 2014}} {{Infobox television | show_name = Prehistoric Park | image = Prehistoric Park Title card.jpg | image_size = | caption = Title card | size = | genre = [[Science fiction]]
[[Docu-fiction]] | runtime = 48 minutes | starring = [[Nigel Marven]] | company = [[Impossible Pictures]] | channel = [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]]
[[Animal Planet]]
[[National Geographic Channel|National Geographic]] | country = [[United Kingdom]] | language = [[English language|English]] | num_seasons = 1 | num_episodes = 6 | first_aired = 22 July 2006 | last_aired = 26 August 2006 | related =''[[Primeval (TV series)|Primeval]]''
''[[Chased by Dinosaurs]]''
''[[Sea Monsters (TV series)|Sea Monsters]]''
''[[Walking with Dinosaurs]]'' }} '''''Prehistoric Park''''' is a six-part [[docu-fiction]] [[television mini-series]] that premiered on [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] on 22 July 2006 and on [[Animal Planet]] on 29 October 2006. The program was produced by [[Impossible Pictures]], who also created ''[[Walking with Dinosaurs]]''. Each episode is an hour long including commercial breaks. Repeats of the show are broadcast in the UK on [[Watch (TV channel)|Watch]]. The program is narrated by [[David Jason]] and presented by [[Nigel Marven]]. The fictional component is the theme that Nigel goes back to various geological time periods through a space-[[time portal]], and brings live specimens of extinct animals back to the present day, where they are exhibited in a [[wildlife park]] named Prehistoric Park, which is a big area between high steep mountains and ocean, with varied environments, in what looks like [[KwaZulu-Natal]] province in [[South Africa]]. ==Story== The story, which is told in the style of a documentary, focuses on naturalist Nigel Marven leading missions to find and collect extinct animals from the distant past by use of a time machine. The animals are then placed in the confines of Prehistoric Park, a private wildlife park that is situated in a dry, mountainous region of an unspecified part of the world. Marven's core motivation in the series is to defy extinction and to give select extinct species a second chance at life. ==Characters== * [[Nigel Marven]] as himself - the main presenter of the show. * Rod Arthur as Bob - the long-suffering head keeper at the park. In charge of feeding, cleaning and controlling the animals in the park. * Suzanne McNabb as Suzanne - the head veterinarian. Responsible for treating animals when they're sick or injured. * Morgan Williams as Ben - one of Nigel's crew. Four ''[[Mei long]]'' attacked him for meat in his backpack. Introduced in episode 3. * [[Saba Douglas-Hamilton]] as herself - a big cat specialist, whom Nigel invites back to catch [[Smilodon]] in episode 4. * Unknown as Bill - a crew member who travels back with Nigel. Introduced in episode 5. * Unknown as Jim - an associate of Nigel who travels with him through time. Also introduced in episode 5. There are various other staff members, but none of their names have been given. One of the more prominent is Suzanne's blonde assistant, who appears in all episodes except episode 1. ==Locations within the park== {{main article|List of locations in Prehistoric Park}} When the animals are brought back to the park, they are placed into a nearby enclosure. The enclosures are named after the extinct animals that they are housing. * '''Mammoth Mount''': This enclosure houses the park's [[woolly mammoth]] Martha. * '''T. rex Hill''': T. rex Hill is home to the park's pair of ''[[Tyrannosaurus rex]]'', Terence and Matilda. * '''Big Cat Climb''': This two part enclosure features a pair of breeding [[sabre-tooth cat]]s. * '''Triceratops Creek''': Theo is the resident ''[[Triceratops]]'' at Triceratops Creek. * '''Deinosuchus Dip''': This is a huge lake, where the park's ''[[Deinosuchus]]'' is kept. * '''Ornithomimus Pond''': This paddock features a herd of ''[[Ornithomimus]]''. * '''The Bug House''': This state of the art enclosure keeps its Carboniferous period creatures safe. Its oxygen levels inside are double what they are today, and this keeps the ''[[Arthropleura]]'', ''[[Meganeura]]'' and ''[[Pulmonoscorpius]]'' happy. ==Episodes== {{main article|List of Prehistoric Park episodes }} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- ! style="padding:0 8px;" rowspan="2" colspan="2"| Series ! style="padding:0 8px;" rowspan="2"| Episodes ! style="padding:0 80px;" colspan="2"| Originally aired |- ! [[Season premiere|Series premiere]] ! [[Season finale|Series finale]] |- | style="background:#2E6159; color:#100; text-align:center;"| | '''1''' | 6 | style="padding: 0 8px;" | {{Start date|2006|7|22|df=y}} | style="padding: 0 8px;" | {{End date|2006|8|26|df=y}} |- |} ==Filming locations== {| class="wikitable" |- !Episode!!Where set!!Where filmed |- |1||[[Montana]], United States||The [[Andes|Andean national parks]] of [[Chile]] where there are plenty of ''[[Araucaria]]'' and ''[[Nothofagus]]'' trees |- |2||[[Siberia]]||The [[Yukon]] in Canada |- |3||[[China]]||[[Rotorua]], New Zealand, in the Redwood, Ohakuri, and Tikitere forests |- |4||[[South America]]||Dry grassland near [[Brasilia]] in [[Brazil]] |- |5||[[Coal forest]] in [[Scotland]]||Swamp forest in southern [[Florida]], but some of the vegetation was [[Computer-generated imagery|CGI]] |- |6||[[Texas]], United States||The freshwater lakes of [[Fraser Island]], Australia |} ==DVD== [[File:Prehistoric park.jpg|thumb|DVD boxset cover art]] * The Region 1 DVD was released on 5 June 2007 by BCI Eclipse, under license from Fremantle Media. * The Region 2 [[DVD]] was released in Britain on 28 August 2006 by [[Fremantle Media]].http://www.itvsuperstore.com/cgi-bin/itv.filereader?44e6dd8500ba6aee2740c0a801a50710+EN/products/682302 * The Region 4 DVD was released in Australia and surrounding islands on 6 October 2006. [[Charles Wooley]] narrated the series when broadcast on Australia's Nine Network, and the Region 4 DVD has the original narration by David Jason. * The Region 3 DVD was released in [[Indonesia]] by Medialine Entertainment. ==See also== * ''[[Paleoworld]]'' * ''[[Dinosaur Planet (TV series)]]'' * ''[[When Dinosaurs Roamed America]]'' * ''[[Wild New World|Prehistoric America]]'' * ''[[Monsters We Met]]'' ==References== ==External links== * [http://www.citv.co.uk/pp ''Prehistoric Park''] at [[itv.com]]/citv (including episode guide and images) * [http://animal.discovery.com/convergence/prehistoricpark/prehistoricpark.html Animal Planet - ''Prehistoric Park''] * [http://www.prehistoricpark.com ''Impossible Pictures'' minisite] * [http://www.nigelmarven.com/photo.asp?g=6 Nigel Marven's production photos] * {{IMDb title|id=0760139|title=Prehistoric Park}} * {{tv.com show|prehistoric-park|Prehistoric Park}} {{Walking with}} {{Impossible Pictures}} [[Category:2006 British television programme debuts]] [[Category:2006 British television programme endings]] [[Category:2000s British television series]] [[Category:Animal Planet shows]] [[Category:ITV documentaries]] [[Category:Documentary films about prehistoric life]] [[Category:Prehistoric Park]] [[Category:British time travel television series]] [[Category:British mockumentary television series]] [[Category:English-language television programs]]

{{multiple issues| {{Orphan|date=January 2013}} {{more citations needed|date=February 2012}} }}
'''Pseudosenility''' also '''reversible dementia''' is a condition where older people are in a state of [[memory loss]], [[Mental confusion|confusion]], or [[Disorientation#Disorientation|disorientation]] that may have a cause other than the ordinary [[Ageing|aging process]].<ref name=libow1>{{cite journal |last=Libow |first=LS |date=1973-03-21 |title=Pseudo-senility: acute and reversible organic brain syndromes |publisher=American Geriatric Society |pmid = 4702407 |volume=21 |journal=J Am Geriatr Soc |pages=112–20 |doi=10.1111/j.1532-5415.1973.tb00855.x}}</ref> Generally, the term "reversible dementia" is used to describe most cases.<ref name="Nixon, S.J. 1996 pp. 107-130">Nixon, S.J. (1996) Secondary dementias: reversible dementias and pseudomentia in R.L. Adams, O.A. Parsons, J.L. Culbertson & S.J. Nixon (Eds.) ''Neuropsychology for Clinical Practice: etiology, assessment, and treatment of common neurological disorder''. (pp. 107-130). Washington, DC: American Psychological Association</ref> A more specific term "Pseudodementia" is referring to "behavioral changes that resembler those of the progressive degenerative dementias, but which are attributable to so-called functional causes".<ref>{{cite journal |author=Jones, R.D., Tranel, D., Benton, A. & Paulsen, J |title=Differentiating dementia from "pseudodementia" early in the clinical course: utility of neuropsychological tests. |journal=Neuropsychology |volume=6 |issue=1 |pages=13–21 |year=1992 |doi=10.1037/0894-4105.6.1.13 |issn=1931-1559 }}</ref>
The ''[[New York Times]]'' reports that illnesses such as the [[Influenza|flu]] and [[hydrocephalus]], as well as side-effects to common medications, can produce symptoms in the elderly that are difficult to distinguish from ordinary [[dementia]] caused by aging. However, if the real cause of the effects is caught early enough, the effects can be reversed.<ref name=isisnt>{{cite web |url=http://newoldage.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/03/11/when-it-isnt-really-senility/ |title=When It Isn't Really Senility |last=Henig |first=Robin Marantz |date=2009-03-11 |publisher=New York Times |accessdate=20 February 2010}}</ref><ref name=alfoa>{{cite web |date=2009-03-17 |url=http://www.alfa.org/alfa/NewsBot.asp?MODE=VIEW&ID=39&SnID=3 |title=Caregivers May Observe 'Pseudosenility' |publisher=Assisted Living Federation of America |accessdate=20 February 2010}}</ref> According to studies cited in Cunha (1990), approximate 10% to 30% of patients who have exhibited symptoms of dementia might have a treatable or reversible pathologic process to some extent.<ref name="Cunha, U.G.V. 1990 261–263">{{cite journal |author=Cunha, U.G.V. |title=An investigation of dementia among elderly outpatients |journal=Acta Psychiatrica Scandinavica |volume=82 |issue=3 |pages=261–263 |year=1990 |doi=10.1111/j.1600-0447.1990.tb03063.x |issn=1600-0447 }}</ref>
==Causes== It should be noticed that describing the causation of reversible dementia is extremely difficult due to the complicated biopsychological systems and the hard-to-define collection of factors associated with cognitive decline. Roughly, the etiological factors that contribute to cognitive decline could be assigned into four categories: chemical, environmental, physical, and psychiatric. Chemical intoxication might be attributed to anesthesia, alcohol, heavy metal and commonly used medications. Jenike (1988) has recorded a certain amount of medications which may induce cognitive change in elder people.<ref name="Thompson">Thompson, T.L. (1987) Dementia. in R.E. Hales & S.C. Yudofsky (Eds), ''Textbook of neuropsychiatry'' (pp.107-124). Washington, DC: American Psychiatric Press</ref> The list is provided below. {| class="sortable" |- ! Antihypertensive agents !! Neuroleptics !! 'Benzodiazepines !! Antiseizure medications !! Antihisatamines !! Anticholinergic agents !! Antiarrythmic agents !! Steroids |- | methyldopa || Haloperidol (Haldol) || Diazepam (Valium) || Barbiturates || Cimetidine (Tagamet) || Atropine || Procainamide || |- | Beserpine || Chlorpromazine (Thorazine) || Flurazepam (Dalmane) || Carbamazepine (Tegretol) || || Beztropine || Disopyramide || |- | Clonidine || Thioridazine (Mellaril) || Clorazepate (Tranxene) || Phenytoin (Dilantin) || || Diphenhydramine || Quinidine || |- | Diuretics || Fluphenazine (Prolixin) || Prazepam (Centrax) || Phenobarbital || || Trihexyphenidyl || || |- | Beta-blockers, especially propranolol (Inderal) || Perphenazine (Trilafon) || Alprazolam (Xanax) || || || || || |- | || Loxapine (Loxitane) || Halazepam (Paxipam) || || || || || |- | || Molindone (Moban) || Triazolam (Halcion) || || || || || |- | || Tiothixene (Navane) || Temazepam (Restoril) || || || || || |- | || Trifluoperazine (Stelazine) || Oxazepam (Serax) || || || || || |- | || ||Lorazepam (Ativan) || || || || || |}<ref>Jenike, M.A. (1988). Depression and other psychiatric disorders in M.S. Albert & M.Moss (Eds.) ''Geriatric Neuropsychology" (pp.115-144). New York, NY: Guilford Press</ref>
Environmental sources include overstimulation, radical changes in lifestyle, and sensory impairment. Physical disorders which are mostly induced by the aging process, consist of thyroid and other endocrine-system deprivation; metabolic disturbance, and vitamin deficiency. Psychiatric disorders, such as chronic schizophrenia and depression could also produce cognitive decline.<ref name="Thompson"/>
In summary, the etiological factors of reversible dementia are various, subtle and frequently interactive. Therefore, in-depth medical and psychosocial evaluations are vital for accurate diagnosis and treatment design. It is important for families and patients to understand the difficulties in determining an correct diagnosis and be prepared for probable frustration and confusion during evaluation and assessment process.<ref name="Nixon, S.J. 1996 pp. 107-130"/>
==Differentiating Pseudodementia from Dementia== As certain of pseudodementia remains potentially treatable, it is essential that they are distinguished from primarily dementia of the Alzheimer's type (DAT), and multi-infarct dementia (MID). For instance, pseudodementia associated with depression (DD) has been found as the most frequently appearing, while as many as 10% to 20% patients are misdiagnosed as primary degenerative dementia (PDD) or vice versa.<ref>{{cite journal |author=desRosiers, G. |title=Primary or depressive dementia: psychometric assessment |journal=Clinical Psychology Review |volume=12 |issue=3 |pages=307–343 |year=1992 |doi=10.1016/0272-7358(92)90140-4}}</ref> A significant overlapping in cognitive and neuropsychological dysfunction in DD and PDD patients seemed to increase the difficulty in diagnosis. However, differences in the severity of impairment and quality of patients' responses could be observed, and DD patients exhibited a greater depressive symptomatology. Additionally, a test of antisaccadic movements may be used to differentiate DD from PDD patients. as PDD patients significantly display poorer performance on this test.<ref name="Nixon, S.J. 1996 pp. 107-130"/> A general comparison between aspects of DD and PDD is shown below. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Variable !! Pseudodementia !! Dementia |- | Onset || More precise, usually in terms of days or weeks || Subtle |- | Course || Rapid, uneven || Slow, worse at night |- | Past history || Depression or mania frequently || Uncertain relation |- | Family history || Depression or mania || Positive family history for dementia in approximately 50% DAT |- | Mood || Depressed; little or no response to sad or funny situations; behavior and affect inconsistent with degree of cognitive deficit || Shallow or labile; normal or exaggerated response to sad or funny situations; consistent with degree of cognitive impairment |- | Cooperation || Poor; little effort to perform well; responds often with "I don't know"; apathetic, emphasizes failure || Good; frustrated by inability to do well; response to queries approximate con fabricated or perseverated; emphasizes trivial accomplishment |- | Memory || Highlight memory loss; greater impairment of personality features (e.g. confidence, drive, interests, and attention) || Denies or minimizes impairments; greater impairment in cognitive features (recent memory and orientation to time and date) |- | Mini-Mental State Exam (MMSE).<ref>{{cite journal |author=Folstein, M.F., Folstein, S.E., & McHugh, P.R. |title= "Mini-Mental State": a practical method for grading the cognitive state of patients for the clinician. |journal= Journal of Psychiatric Research |volume= 12|issue=3 |pages=189–198 |year=1975 |doi=10.1016/0022-3956(75)90026-6 |pmid=1202204}}</ref> || Changeable on repeated tests || Stable on repeated tests |- | Symptoms || Increased psychologic symptoms:sadness, anxiety, somatic symptoms || Increased neurologic symptoms: dysphasia, dyspraxia, agnosia, incontinence |- | Computed Tomography (CT) and Electroencephalogram (EEG) || Normal for age || Abnormal |}<ref name="Nixon, S.J. 1996 pp. 107-130"/>
In general, pseudodementia patients present a considerable cognitive deficits, including disorders in learning, memory and psychomotor performance. Substantial evidences from brain imaging such as CT scanning and positron emission tomography (PET) have also revealed abnormalities in brain structure and function.<ref name="Nixon, S.J. 1996 pp. 107-130"/>
==Prognosis== Since the term of "reversible" has been used, it simply implies a high possibility of recovery from the disease. Cunha (1990) examined the recovery process of 26 patients with reversible dementia. Unfortunately, only 2 patients have found as return to normal function indicated by the MMSE scores.<ref name="Cunha, U.G.V. 1990 261–263"/> Poor results have also been reported in Copeland et al. (1992)'s studies, as 1 out of 21 DD patients had fully recovered.<ref>{{cite journal |author=Copeland, J.R.M., Davidson, I.A., Dewey, M.E., Gilmore, C., Larkin, B.A., McWilliam, C., Saunders, P.A., Scott, A., Sharma, V., & Sullivan, C. |title=Alzheimer's disease, other dementias, depression and pseudodementia: prevalence, incidence and three-year outcome in Liverpool. |journal=British Journal of Psychiatry |volume=161 |issue=Aug |pages=230–239 |year=1992 |doi=10.1192/bjp.161.2.230 |issn=1472-1465 }}</ref> Thus, attention should be arisen that the diagnosis of reversible or pseudodementia needs to be given with extreme care, and the recovery pattern for individual patient remains uncertain.<ref name="Nixon, S.J. 1996 pp. 107-130"/>
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Aging-associated diseases]] [[Category:Cognitive disorders]] [[Category:Geriatric psychiatry]] [[Category:Neurobiological brain disorder]] [[Category:Psychiatric diagnosis: marginal or unestablished diagnostic categories]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox military person |name = Pyotr Dolgov |birth_date = {{birth date|df=y|1920|02|21}} |death_date = {{death date and age|df=y|1962|11|01|1920|02|21}} |birth_place = |death_place = |placeofburial= |image = Pyotr Ivanovich Dolgov.jpg |image_size = |caption = Pyotr Dolgov |nickname = |allegiance = {{USSR}} |branch = [[Soviet Air Force]] |serviceyears = 1940 - 1962 |rank = [[Colonel]] |commands = |unit = |battles = |awards = {{Hero of the Soviet Union}} {{Order of Lenin}} |relations = |laterwork = }} '''Pyotr Ivanovich Dolgov''' ({{lang-ru|Пётр Долгов}}; 21 February 1920 – 1 November 1962) ([[Hero of the Soviet Union]])<ref name="warheroes">{{cite web|url=http://www.warheroes.ru/hero/hero.asp?Hero_id=1875|title=Hero of the Soviet Union Pyotr Dolgov: Heroes of the country|author=Ufarkinym, Nikolai V.|date=2000–2011|accessdate=6 September 2011|publisher=Патриотический интернет проект "Герои Страны"}}</ref> was a [[colonel]] in the [[Soviet Air Force]]. Dolgov died while carrying out a high-altitude [[parachute]] jump from a [[Volga balloon]] gondola.<ref name="warheroes"/><ref name="Astronautix">{{cite web|url=http://astronautix.com/astros/dolgov.htm|title=Dolgov|accessdate=6 September 2011|publisher=astronautix.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110927040650/http://astronautix.com/astros/dolgov.htm|archivedate=27 September 2011|df=}}</ref><ref name="Vector Site">{{cite web|url=http://www.vectorsite.net/tamrc_15.html|title=[15.0] Stepping Up The Pace|author=Goebel, Greg|accessdate=6 September 2011|publisher=vectorsite.net}}</ref><ref name="Footnote">Dolgov's year of death is given as both 1961 and 1962 by the [http://astronautix.com/index.html Encyclopedia Astronautica], but as 1962 by Goebel and at warheroes.ru. 1962 is correct, as shown by the ''Der Spiegel'' obituary cited below.</ref>
==Early life and career== Dolgov was born into a family of [[farmer]]s in the village of Bogoyavlenskoye (now Dolgovo) in [[Zemetchinsky District]], [[Penza Oblast]]. He served with the [[Soviet airborne]] in [[World War II]].<ref name="warheroes"/> In January 1945, Dolgov became a company commander in the [[350th Guards Rifle Regiment]] of the [[114th Guards Airborne Division|114th Guards Rifle Division]]. Dolgov participated in the [[Budapest Offensive]] and the [[Vienna Offensive]]. On 6 April, Dolgov reportedly knocked out a self-propelled gun and killed 40 German soldiers. He was wounded but allegedly refused to leave the battlefield. Dolgov graduated from the [[Ryazan Higher Airborne Command School]] in 1947.<ref name="warheroes" />
He reportedly designed the [[ejection seat]]s for the [[Vostok spacecraft]].<ref name="Spiegel">{{cite journal|journal=[[Der Spiegel]]|title=DER SPIEGEL 47/1962 - PJOTR IWANOWITSCH DOLGOW|issue=47|date=21 November 1962|url=http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/d-45125021.html|language=German|accessdate=19 October 2012}}</ref>
==Death== On 1 November 1962, Dolgov and [[Yevgeni Nikolayevich Andreyev|Eugene Andreyev]] ascended in a Volga [[balloon]] gondola from [[Volsk]], near [[Saratov]],<ref name="StratoCat">{{cite web|url=http://stratocat.com.ar/globos/1962e.htm|title=Stratospheric balloons launched worldwide in 1962|year=2012|publisher=StratoCat|accessdate=15 October 2012}}</ref> to make high-altitude parachute jumps. Andreyev successfully completed his jump. Dolgov, testing an experimental [[pressure suit]], jumped at 28,640 meters (93,970 ft). The helmet visor of Dolgov's pressure suit hit part of the gondola as he exited, and the suit depressurized, killing him.<ref name="warheroes"/><ref name="Astronautix"/><ref name="Vector Site"/> On 12 December 1962, Dolgov was posthumously named a [[Hero of the Soviet Union]].<ref name="warheroes"/>
If Dolgov's jump had been successful, he still would not have exceeded the record set by [[Joseph Kittinger]] for the highest-altitude parachute jump in history (31,300 meters, 16 August 1960). The current world record is held by [[Alan Eustace]] (41,425 meters, 24 October 2014).
==Legacy== At the time of Dolgov's death, the [[Soviet Army]] newspaper ''[[Krasnaya Zvezda|Red Star]]'' announced that he had died in the course of "carrying out his duties".<ref name="Spiegel"/> Over the years there have been [[Lost cosmonauts|false reports]] that Dolgov actually died on 11 October 1960, in a failed flight of a Vostok spacecraft.<ref name="Astronautix"/><ref name="Vector Site"/>
A fictionalized version of Dolgov's death (incorrectly dated in February 1961) appears in the short story "[[The Chief Designer (novella)|The Chief Designer]]" by [[Andy Duncan (writer)|Andy Duncan]], which was published in ''[[Asimov's Science Fiction]]'' magazine and was a [[Hugo Award|Hugo]] finalist.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20110927040650/http://astronautix.com/astros/dolgov.htm Dolgov at Encyclopedia Astronautica] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20051228231500/http://www.asimovs.com/Nebulas03/thechief.shtml Text of "The Chief Designer"] *[http://www.asfs.org/id21.htm Interview with Andy Duncan about "The Chief Designer"] *[http://www.warheroes.ru/hero/hero.asp?Hero_id=1875 Biography at warheroes.ru]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Dolgov, Pyotr}} [[Category:1920 births]] [[Category:1962 deaths]] [[Category:Accidental deaths in the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Heroes of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:People from Tambov Governorate]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Red Banner]] [[Category:Russian balloonists]] [[Category:Soviet Air Force officers]] [[Category:Soviet military personnel of World War II]] [[Category:Space diving]] [[Category:Stalin Prize winners]] [[Category:Personnel of the Soviet Airborne Forces]]
